comments:
I'm using Eclipse 20020125 with Team Support plugins and JDK 1.3.1_02.

When trying to update a 10.5MB binary file called "cocoon.war" from a CVS
repository, Eclipse gets the file from the server ("Receiving file cocoon.war
(10,623K of 10,625K)") but before the "Updating" dialog disappears, Eclipse
displays a dialog that says, simply "Internal error".  The cocoon.war file ends
up being 0KB (presumably it's just not closed).  The CVS console simply displays:

? lib/cocoon.war
U lib/cocoon.war

without any error messages.

Hopefully the error should have been logged to the 
${workspace_directory}/.metadata/.log file. Can you copy it here?

I have two different errors in the log:

Log: Tue Jan 29 16:00:26 EST 2002
4 org.eclipse.team.ui 1 Internal error
org.eclipse.team.core.TeamException: Error retrieving remote resource tree
	at
org.eclipse.team.ccvs.core.CVSTeamProvider.getRemoteSyncTree(CVSTeamProvider.java:605)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.sync.CVSSyncCompareInput.createSyncElements(CVSSyncCompareInput.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.sync.SyncCompareInput.prepareInput(SyncCompareInput.java:197)
	at org.eclipse.compare.CompareEditorInput.run(CompareEditorInput.java:288)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:98)
Log: Tue Jan 29 16:06:41 EST 2002
4 org.eclipse.team.ui 1 Update
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

I think the OutOfMemoryError is the "Internal error" that I saw.  Is there some
way of setting -Xmx256M or something with Eclipse?

By the way, thanks for such a quick response!  I'm very impressed (with your
response time, as well as with Eclipse :) ).

Fixed in build > 20020401

Ooops, file transfers were done entirely in memory. Now, they are streamed to
disk and in case of merged updates temporary files are created.
